messageBody:
No, our unit tests dont have a working db connection.

None of our unit tests use dbs,files,network,ui We mock them all. Our
acceptance tests drives these very thin layers.



Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:
>
> On 8/28/06, Andrew McDonagh <yahoogroups@...
> <mailto:yahoogroups%40andrewmcdonagh.f2s.com>> wrote:
> >
> > I haven't found this to be the case during the last 4 years.
> >
> > Especially since using Fit/Fitnesse. Each Fitnesse test runs a 'setup'
> > fixture for connecting to the DB, if it failed for any reason, the setup
> > would fail long before the actual acceptance test itself.
>
> Then I understand even less: if you already have a working DB connection
> when your unit tests run, why not test close() directly on it?
>
> Are you running SQL queries on a JDBC connection in your unit tests or
> using
> a mock there as well?
>
> --
